comments.commentBody: The trouble is, the real numbers won't show things like "110% of the people voted for Clinton", but Trump and his team will find ways of making up "proof" of things like that, and his base will believe it.

Moral capital! Bleeding heart liberals have more of it.?????!,
Not in respect to the Abortion issue.
Roe vs Wade ushered in an era of utilizing a necessary procedure when a woman was at risk or a fetus not viable for life.
Liberals turned it into a form of birth control for the ignorant , poor , and apathetic.
Originally allowed as a Choice for first trimester pregnancies , liberals succeeded in allowing abortions well into the 2nd and 3rd trimesters.
Liberalism and Conservatism have pushed back too much against our social mores and values.
Compromise must begin again in government and in our personal lives .
Ignorance of civics at all levels leads to a stupid populace controlled by media and cultures of personality.
Republicans and Democrats must take a stand and stop this train. Voters need to turn on the two party system and vote 3rd party and then the legislature must decide. 30 plus years of political gerrymandering of voting districts has created this debacle. It allowed poor leadership and self serving career politicians to debase our Republic. Trump and his co- conspirators is our burden . And he will lose the election and be our curse as he pouts publicly and feeds off the media which won't forget him . Those rating are more important than the grand experiment called the USA.

Bruce Rozenblitt:
I always respect and enjoy your comments but I have a problem aligning the premise of the G.O.P. as the only culprit when the majority of Wall Street(You gotta love the pictures of Hillary and Blankfein) and hedge funders are firmly in The Democratic camp, not to mention the fact that the health care behemoths such as United Health and Anthema are enjoying record profits under the A.C.A. and this administration, this as our co pays and premiums rise and the care is the worst in my seventy plus years, Chuck Schummer, a Democrat, has not exactly been a proponent for reform in his position as banking chairman and the wars will surely escalate under Hillary. We had a chance at change with Bernie, but until the D.N.C. as well as the G.O.P. are reigned in we will continue on the path to oligarchy.
All I see in abortion foes is body-snatching enslavers of women.

Moral capital cannot exist without respect for the truth. Without respect for the truth, we cannot respect each other because none of us then stand for anything. Life becomes a continuous con job. It becomes a do whatever you can get away with exercise.

Unrestrained capitalism has no respect for the truth. Unrestrained libertarianism doesn't need the truth. Trump and his followers don't need the truth.

A difference of opinion is one thing, like preferring nuclear power over solar, or local public schools over charter schools. But when entire political movements trash all semblance of the truth to acquire power, the whole business of governance grinds to a halt. That's where we are in America today. That's why Trump has risen to such a height.

Right wing media began because some thought that their views were not being aired. Once they corrected that problem, they kept going and lost their grip on reality. The quest for power and money took over. They lost respect for the truth. In doing so, they bankrupted their moral capital and gave us Trump.

Moral capital involves the consideration of people lives, the quality of their experiences and their basic needs. The quest for profits only cares about its own perpetuation and not about where it goes and how they are used.

The repairs to moral capital need to be concentrated on the right side of the isle. We bleeding hearts have always had more moral capital than profits.

After WWII we rebuilt Japan and Europe; we built the U. S. interstate highway system; our highest tax bracket was 75%; and we had a growth rate of over 3%. Question: What can't we do that during the new Clinton administration?
My heart goes out to you and your family -- thank you for helping more of us understand.
Can this be a surprise?  Trump claimed primaries were rigged until the moment he won...then all such claims vanished.  Then it was simply a face-saving tactic.  Now it's a threat.

You can vote with your feet, or your eyes, and ignore the NYTs if this Trump coverage continues post debate.

He will still dominate news cycles though, at least for a few weeks after the election.
No. It will be filled to capacity with Trump supporters.
I'm impressed. You know a synonym for hell. Good to mix it up now and then.

@Raymond Sullivan: Oh, trust me, there's more than enough room down there for the smug, sanctimonious, fundamentally dishonest Hillary and her supporters, as well.

The level of willful ignorance and sheer stupidity in this country (particularly among HRC supporters) is truly something to behold. And you, sir, are a prime example!

Trump is a salesman - not a debater. When given the chance he should have pointed out the Clintons' massive charitable frauds. For example, Haitians received absolutely no benefit from the Clinton Foundation's Haitian earthquake relief program. Only the Clintons and their cronies benefited.

And, in connection with the Clinton Foundation's distribution of HIV/aids drugs, Trump should have pointed out that the drugs were so watered down that they were of no benefit.

The Foundation skimmed tens of millions of dollars from government subsidies funding the program. According to a May 15, 2013 Fortune article, "On May 13, 2013, Ranbaxy (the distributor of the drugs) pleaded guilty to seven federal criminal counts of selling adulterated drugs with intent to defraud, failing to report that its drugs didn’t meet specifications, and making intentionally false statements to the government. Ranbaxy agreed to pay $500 million in fines, forfeitures, and penalties — the most ever levied against a generic-drug company." http://fortune.com/2013/05/15/dirty-medicine/

The Clintons belong in jail - not in the White House.

He's manipulating his base and everyone else. Given his track record of duplicitous and incoherent statements, when he says "Of course I would accept a clear election result...", what makes you take it seriously? If he makes 1 in 10 reasonable statements, he still has no credibility.
Well, Ken, I'm deeply disappointed that you don't know that it was Bush, not Gore, who took legal action in 2000.  Florida was doing an automatic recount and Bush sued to stop it.

The problem is that Trump states two (or more) conflicting statements - as he often does, so that he, in his own mind - and in many others apparently - can have it both ways.

But you cannot have it both ways - that is the essence of ACCOUNTABILITY. And as it always turns out with Trump, he can, and does, in the very next statement - deny that he has said either one - and will continue to deny it - no matter what. (There are so many instances of this that it is beyond arguement.)

No, the problem is Trump's unmittigated arrogance above country, society, honesty, and integrity - all rules are beneath him - and that is the core problem with Trump that makes him so dangerous.
Are you that blind? Pence never had any decency to begin with. Look at the man's record. And don't forget he is a republican. Show me one republican who has any decency. Just one.

Trump calling Clinton dishonest. How rich! Is it possible that he
just might be the most un-self aware adult on earth? His hypocrisy, idiocy, and hubris are truly breathtaking.

I'm not sure why Trump's latest speakings are printed anymore.  His words have so little relationship to reality, or what he said last, or what he will say next.  It's to the point now that when I click on the NYT, I kind of clench up, getting ready to see "Trump Froths at Mouth while Throwing Cleaning Staff Off Balcony" or something.  It's just a matter of time, you know.
I beg to differ, they've always been about winning all the way back to Jefferson and Hamilton.
Now he's just toying with the media idjits! Who would call for a recount if they won?

Who cares if he doesn't accept the results of the election? John Roberts is only going to swear in one person. What's he going to do? Sue somebody? Still, very interesting to hear that even Rush Limbaugh is not 100% behind him
We American voters (millions of us) will stop him when Hillary Clinton wins in a landslide.

He's a mean clown with a vindictive streak and millions to permit it.
Who knows how that will pan out?
Not funny.

You treat trump too seriously. He is merely a clown, a wealthy, il-informed, tasteless clown, who has mastered that manner to please himself and found his manner accepted by others. 'It is only trump.' And his millions permit it.
Annie Dooley: I have had the same observation. These so called "angry people" are the ones that have the least to be angry about!
Trump TV cable network.  He would make billions.  I suppose you plan to be one of his guest.

Trump is just self-promoting to build an audience for his upcoming Trump TV cable network. That is not a joke. It really is what he's doing. He conceded the election to Hillary weeks ago, but he has to keep his face in the media somehow.

Trump never wanted to be President. Even as clueless as he is, which is intergalactic, he knows he could never handle the demands of the office. All he's ever wanted to do is to RUN for office. To him, the election is a game. Or, more correctly, just an extension of his trash game show mentality. Note the word "reality" isn't in that description.

But it isn't a game to Americans, who on November 8th will show him how detested he is. THAT is "reality", Donald.

This soup is absolutely delicious! BUT I thought it would have been a bit overkill to strain + put butter, creme fraiche and olive oil on top. I put a tiny dollop (too much will kill the flavor) of the creme fraiche on top and it was amazing without the other details!! I actually forgot about the brown butter until I was serving, but it really doesn't need it. I ate this with grilled bread and it was perfect.

I had it this evening and thought it an A+. Here are some things I changed:
1) I doused the fish with lemon juice before marinating
2) Doubled the garlic
3) Used turmeric instead of saffron
4) White Zinfandel instead of dry white. Also 2x the red pepper so sweet/hot balance result was very dynamic.
5) Fish stock = 2/3 clam juice and 1/3 was stock strained from skin, bones, and some flesh of fish I had in stew (halibut & salmon) along w/ chicken bouillon. I let it simmer for 2-3 hours.

Part 1/2: So good!! I very loosely followed this very flexible recipe (adapted to ingredients I had on hand) and turned out with an outstanding frittata that was perfectly cooked and extremely flavorful. The many changes I made (just to show how flexible the recipe is!)
- Used 6 eggs since that's all I had
- Used ~3 T of greek yogurt since I didn't have milk
- Didn't peel tomatoes (absolutely fine; don't deal with this silly step!)

Part 2/2:
- Used aprox 2 lbs tomatoes (prob closer to 1.75 since the fried tomatoes are so good plain!)
- Used a 12" pan since that's all I had; did adjust the final cooking time down to about 5 min from 10 due (thinner frittata due to fewer eggs and larger pan)
- Used green onions and sage instead of chives and basil - SO GOOD!
- Omitted garlic since I didn't have it
- Didn't broil at the end since I was ready to EAT and didn't want to bother.

My tomatoes were out of season, but I found that I needed a bit more than a splash of stock and an extra tomato for the nice broth pictured here. The soup is delightful garnished with fresh basil and grated parmesan. I will be making this often!
